items.title: Magnetically induced convection enhances water electrolysis in microgravity
items.summary: Nature Chemistry, Published online: 18 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41557-025-01890-0 Electrochemical devices producing oxygen in space face limited buoyancy, hindering gas bubble removal and increasing reaction overpotentials. Now, it has been shown that commercial magnets can enhance the reaction efficiency and induce phase separation in microgravity. The optimized magnetoelectrochemical architectures developed here may guide the designs of future life-support systems.

items.title: Lattice O–O ligands in Fe-incorporated hydroxides enhance water oxidation electrocatalysis
items.summary: Nature Chemistry, Published online: 18 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41557-025-01898-6 While the ligand coordination microenvironment surrounding catalytic centres influences reactivity, dynamic oxygen reconstruction during water oxidation electrocatalysis complicates structure-based mechanistic insights. Now the in situ formation of lattice O–O ligands has been shown to activate Fe centres in metal oxides and hydroxides, thereby enhancing their oxygen evolution reaction activity.
